i1.blurb: Veigar is the greatest Evil to ever strike at the hearts of Runeterra - and he's only getting bigger! Striking an enemy Champion with a spell or scoring a takedown grants Veigar permanently increased Ability Power.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Veigar''' gains a stack of {{ai|Phenomenal Evil Power|Veigar|Phenomenal Evil}} whenever he hits an enemy [[champion]] with an ability, and 5 stacks whenever he scores a champion {{tip|takedown}}.
'''Veigar''' gains {{as|1 ability power}} for every stack of {{ai|Phenomenal Evil Power|Veigar|Phenomenal Evil}}.
i1.name: Phenomenal Evil Power
notes: * Stacks are gained for ''landing'' the ability, not dealing damage, and so is triggered by {{ai|Event Horizon|Veigar}} and even versus spell-immune or magic-shielded targets.
* The two effects stack, granting 6 stacks for each enemy champion takedowned by an ability, 7 with {{ai|Baleful Strike}}.

q1.blurb: Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy that deals magic damage to the first two enemies hit. Units killed by this bolt grant Veigar some ability power permanently.
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} Killing a unit with ''Baleful Strike'' grants 1 stack of {{ai|Phenomenal Evil Power|Veigar|Phenomenal Evil}}, doubled against large [[minion]]s and [[monster]]s.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Veigar''' unleashes a bolt of dark energy in the target direction, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to the first two enemies hit.
q1.name: Baleful Strike
notes: * Killing two enemy champions with ''Baleful Strike'' grants {{tt|{{as|+14 AP}}|+12 from ''Phenomenal Evil Power'' and +2 from ''Baleful Strike''}}.
* Champion [[Champion summoned units|decoys]] (''such as {{cai|Mirror Image|LeBlanc}}'') do not count as "champions", but are considered "units" and thus grant {{as|+1 AP}}.
* Units killed by {{iis|Luden's Echo}} [[passive]] bolts can not grant extra {{as|ability power}}.

e1.blurb: After a brief delay Veigar twists the edges of space around the target location for 3 seconds, stunning enemies who pass through the perimeter.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Veigar''' forms a cage around the target location which materializes after a {{fd|0.5}} second delay and lasts for 3 seconds, {{tip|knockdown|knocking down}} and {{tip|stun|stunning}} all enemies who pass through its edges for the first time.
e1.name: Event Horizon
notes: * ''Event Horizon'' can only {{tip|stun}} a unit once per cast. A unit will not be {{tip|stun|stunned}} twice if they walk through the perimeter again after recovering from an initial {{tip|stun}}.
** A champion that [[spell shield]]s the stun will be immune to it even if he walks through the perimeter again.
** {{ai|Glory in Death|Sion}} allows an ''Event Horizon'' to stun ''Sion'' twice.
* {{tip|Blink|Blinks}} and {{tip|untargetable|untargetabilities}} (i.e {{cai|Riftwalk|Kassadin}}, {{cai|Playful|Fizz}}) are not stopped by ''Event Horizon''.
* Forced movement of a unit by {{tip|airborne|knockbacks}} or {{tip|airborne|pulls}} such as {{ai|Rocket Grab|Blitzcrank}} through ''Event Horizon's'' perimeter will be stopped.

r1.blurb: Blasts target enemy champion, dealing a large amount of magic damage, increasing based on the target's missing health.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Veigar''' blasts the target enemy champion with primordial energy, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to them, increased by {{as|{{pp|type=target's '''missing''' health|11|key=%|0 to 100|key1=%|0 to 100*2/3|displayformula=1.5% per 1% of target's '''missing''' health. ''This is capped at 66.66% '''missing''' health.''}}|health}}.
leveling: {{st|Minimum Damage|{{ap|175 to 325}} {{as|(+ 75% AP)}}|Maximum Damage|{{ap|175*2 to 325*2}} {{as|(+ 150% AP)}}}}
r1.name: Primordial Burst
